As Trey continued to exhibit his power, he felt his body aching and cramping again, but he welcomed the pain for he knew that afterwards, he would grow again and continue his asencion. The pain faded and Trey grew more and more, his already unbelievably huge feet growing larger and spreading over more territory. The growth was fast and it was intense, pushing Trey through the clouds and out of the atmosphere.

All over the world people were being crushed by the evergrowing god, their lives ended just as they started worshipping. Soon, Trey's feet covered all of Japan and he had to shift his stance, one foot on Japan and one on Asia. Soon, he was too big for Japan and the country started sinking into the ocean, unable to withstand the awesome might of Trey. Luckily for them, Trey stepped fully onto Asia and Europe as he continued to grow more and more. His chest passed out of the atmosphere followed by his stomach and waist after that. Feeling the gravity of the Earth no longer able to hold him back, Trey leapt from the surface of the Earth to hover next to it. His growth slowed down as the Earth became the size of a power ball to him, small and fragile, his to do with it what he wanted.

Yoh watched from Trey's foot, unable to see anything above him except the collosal movements of Trey's body as he decided what to do with the Earth. His body had already developed a gravitation pull and an atmosphere was being created out of his immense furyoku. Trey's body was habitable.

But what does he do with the Earth?
125121212111122112121.title: Final Ascention

choices: We continue from Yoh/Zeke/Len (The Tinies) POV
1251212121111221121211.content:
Trey had changed. He was no longer human, no longer a shaman. He could only be described as one thing. A god.

Like a divine being, Trey smiled down at the tiny planet. It was being shaken from the massive power extending from Trey's body. At this point it seemed silly to end the planet. No, Trey had better plans for the earth.

Using his immense powers, Trey transported every city, village and person from the planet and placed them on his now habitable body. On one place, the soles of his feet.

This made Trey laugh as he knew the entire planet now existed on his soles. The sweaty soles of a teenager was now the world for an entire race.

"The world really is beneath my feet!" he laughed.

*-*-*-*-*-*

It had been weird for the earthlings. First villages and cities were demolished by gigantic feet, and then they expanded until they dwarfed the planet. Suddenly there was a flash and everything changed. The people were still in their cities, their homes. But the earth had changed. It was now covered in massive crevices.

America was located on his right heel. Europe existed around the massive toes. Continents existed on the soles of a god.
1251212121111221121211.title: A new world

choices: Make the pilgrimage to talk to Trey
Find another way to talk to Trey
12512121211112211212111.content:
Yoh looked around in mild suprise. He had ceased to be amazed by Trey's continous growth and had just waited it out to see what would happen. He had been surprised to see the rest of the world get transported onto Trey's feet where he was currently standing. He had also shrunk back to his normal size since the danger to him had passed and the spiritual energies that had come to him in his panic dissipated. However, Yoh's troubles were not over.

"Yoh what the hell is going on here?!?!?" A voice yelled from a short distance away.

Yoh turned and saw Len walking towards him, a furious look on his face.

"Oh hey Len." Yoh said simply.

"Don't give me any of that!" Len yelled back, now standing next to Yoh. "What's been going on these last few hours?"

So Yoh explained what had happened, how he had crashed into a massive foot in the woods, how he had climbed it and discovered the giant was Trey, how he had finally got his attention, how Trey had grown bigger than the planet and how they were all now on the soles of his feet. Len slapped a hand to his head and muttered, "Great. Just great. Now what are we supposed to do?"

"Nothing?" Yoh said. "I mean, is it really so bad living on Trey's feet? They don't stink too bad and there's air and stuff."

"I don't know about you but I don't live at another man's feet!" Len snapped. "I'm going to find some way to shrink him back down and restore us to the Earth if it's the last thing I do!"

Yoh was about to answer when he spotted a small group of people walking by. Each one of them had a large back pack and seemed intent on long travel.

"Hey! Where are you all going?" Yoh shouted out to the travelers.

A man turned to him and said, "We're making a pilgrimage to speak with this new god. We don't know if we'll make it, but we're determined to try! Would you like to join us?"

Yoh thought about it. If they traveled with the group they might reach a place to talk to Trey. Did these people know something he didn't? Or might it be safer to try a different plan of contacting Trey?

What to do...
12512121211112211212111.title: Adjusting to the New Planet

125121212111122112121111.content:
And verily, thusly, verily, our heroes decided to join with the pilgrimage to consort with Trey at the very top. But HO! The task before them would not be an easy one, for his size became mightier than mightable, so climbing to the top of said giant would prove difficult and time consuming... and even if they managed to reach the top... how would Trey greet his old friends? Provided he could still SEE them!

"Sure thing!" Yoh said to the man, "We'll come with you. Uh... but how are you gonna get there?" Yoh's suspicions were right. The people DID know more about this journey than he thought.
"Well, as you can guess, there's two colossal paths to take to get to the top," the man pointed toward Trey's legs, "A left path and a right path. After a long, vigorous climb, the paths will intersect and-"

Len was not liking what he was hearing. Because it was obvious where the leg 'paths' end! "Are you bloody mad?!" he interjected in that obvious cockney accent despite the fact he's Chinese, "Are you insinuating that to get to Trey, we're going to scamper through his crotch?!"
"There's no other way," the man told him, "anyway, that wont be our biggest problem... yet. Each leg itself is a journey of it's own. Up the left leg, there's an arctic continent ruled by a parasitic demon of ice named Shiro. The right leg, however, is a volcanic continent ruled by Ifreet, the parasitic demon of fire."

"Heh. Cool," Yoh seems to be hanging on the man's every word while Len tries to hold back his urge to smack him! "Which leg are you guys climbing?"
"Because Shiro is a kind and friendly demon that welcomes visitors, we'll go up the left leg. It's really chilly, but we'll have a better chance of surviving than crossing Ifreet's land. That cold-hearted brute will burn us to a crisp if we even THINK of treading through his fire continent!"

It looked like the choice was obvious... but it only LOOKED like, because of a certain unhappy camper. "Grr... this is ridiculous!" Len groaned, "Im going to waste my time climbing up a colossal fool when it could be better spent preparing for my domination of the planet!"
"Aw c'mon! Cheer up, Lenny!" Yoh tried to calm him down, "Trey's a good friend of ours, so we owe it to him to help this guy out!"

There was no point arguing with Yoh. No matter what Len would say, his partner/rival already made up his mind! After gritten his teeth, he finally bit, "Urgggh... FINE! But Im going my own way!"
The moment Trey's humongous feet came in contact with eachother, Len jumped to the other foot!
"Len!" Yoh shouted, "Where you going?"

"Im not going to waste my time babysitting those cretins!" Len pointed toward the group of people headed to the left leg, "....Besides..." Len's face gave a little grin just before whipping out his trusty guandao (polespear), "Im detecting a huge wave of furyoku coming from the 'fire continent'... dont wait up!"

Looks like Len's mind was made up, too! Unfortunately, it was clouded by a lust for power! Yoh didnt want to abandon him and let him go off on his own at this point. It would be too dangerous.
But then again, he didnt want to leave the group of people heading for the left leg. They were no shamans and whether they could survive this journey on their own seemed too big a risk to take! It felt like it was his sworn duty to protect these people!

...But as his partner, it was his duty to protect Len, too. Now wouldnt be a good time to be separated! Besides... what other terrors could lie in the world that is Trey's body?!
Where should Asakura's faith lie? Who comes first?
125121212111122112121111.title: Where your faith lies...

choices: Yoh and Len disagree and journey alone
1251212121111221121211112.content:
'Darn it' thought Yoh. He really wanted to go with the group through the easy path, but Len was his friend.
He watched as high in the sky the right foot came closer once again to the left. Using all his power he launched himself from the left foot, and crashed into the right foot.

Looking around Yoh saw Len sitting there.
"I knew you'd come for me." he said.

"Where are we?" asked Yoh, since he didn't know where on the foot they were. As they were speaking high above them the left foot moved away from the right foot, and soon there was nothing but darkness in the sky.

"As far as I can tell, we're in the middle of the sole of his big toe." Len replied.

Yoh tried to convince Len to quit his foolish quest.
"Len, think about it. What can we do? I mean, look, we're on a big toe. Look at it, his big toe alone is larger than the earth ever was. Its so large we don't even know what direction to go!" Yoh pleaded. "Can't we just go home and let things be?"

"That's not good enough for me Yoh. I'm going to find a way to take over and we'll see how Trey likes living on a sole." Len replied cockily.

Yoh gave up and the two started to walk. Soon they found themselves entering a large city. Looking around they saw statues of Trey, gigantic golden statues with people worshipping them.
1251212121111221121211112.title: Like Len could be convinced! As if.

choices: Yoh and Len arrive at the continent of Fire. Ruled by Efreet
Yoh and Len notice the Prinny and attempt to interrogate him
12512121211112211212111121.content:
Even though Yoh wouldn't mind living on Trey's sole, he just couldn't leave his friend Len as he attempts a most likely futile attempt to contact the giant and make him shrink. "All right. I'll go with you." Yoh huffed as he thought of all the trouble they might get into on their journey from the big toe to Trey's legs and beyond.

"Good. I knew you would choose to help me." Len told him as they walked through the city filled with Trey worshipping humans. "After all, if I attempt to make Trey shrink he'll most likely eat me or *gulp* do other things to me." Len replied back, his entire body shivering with fear. And if there was one thing Len didn't like, it was knowing that he was att he mercy of the world's biggest idiot(literally!).

"Glad to hear I'm not the only one afraid!" Yoh smiled as they exited the city and onto a seemingly endless plain that was Trey's big toenail.

"Who said I was afraid?!" Len shouted angrily at him, starting a huge argument as they proceeded on their journey. However, what the two didn't notice was that they were being spied upon.

Not too far away was a Stitched up blue Penguin with peg legs and two tiny demon wings watching them. It had grabbed a video camera from out of its pouch and was secretly recording them. "Dood! Once Etna sees how hard I'm working she'll definetly increase my wages to .48 Cents Doods!" The Penguin shouted happily as it secretly followed the two boys on their journey.

----Far Far Away upon the great Nose----

"BWAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHA!" Shouted a evil demon prince from his dark and brooding castle. He sat upon his throne, watching his plasmascreen television and the two idiots who were on a journey. "Those fools think they transform MY ultimate warship into a ordinary person!? Never I say! Never! I will crush those insects before they even have the chance!" Shouted the Overlord of the Starship Planet Trey in Galaxy Omega VIIII.

Sitting next to his throne was a Blonde Haired girl dressed completly in white and had the cuteness and innocence of a angel. That and she had small angel wings on her back. "Laharl! Don't tell me you would hurt your warships friends?! The power of love will never allow you to do such a thing!" The angel girl shouted with joy as hearts began to completly surround her with words in the middle like 'love' and 'justice conquers all!'.

"Silence Flonne! I'll not have you spitting justice and love at this time!" Laharl laughed evilly as he pressed a button on his throne, causing a hole to appear beneath her.

"Meanie!" Flonne shouted as she fell deep into the hole that lead to the pit of suffering and agony.

"BWAHAHAHAHAHAHA! Soon the entire Universe will be mine!" Laughed the Sinister Laharl as he prepared for Universal Domination.
12512121211112211212111121.title: What!? Prinnes? What's next Elvis?

choices: They are attacked as soon as they enter
They rest at the temple and move on
125121212111122112121111211.content:
Day after day, trekking miles across the vast expanse of Trey's foot, Yoh and Len finally made it to the leg. Strangely, the leg was covered in what appeared to be magma, rock, volcanoes, rivers of fire and lava, and other such strange things. The demon that lived on the leg must've changed the landscape.

"You know, it's kind of ironic that there's a land of fire on Trey when he's an ice shaman." Yoh said.

"Shut up." Len replied, crossing into this fiery domain.

As soon as their feet touched the new ground, an incredible heat and humidity blasted them. Almost at once their bodies were covered in a thin sheen of sweat. It was like walking into an oven. But these boys were ovbiously tough, despite their age and attire, and pressed on into uncharted land.

Several hours later, thirsty, tired, and covered in sweat, they were regretting taking this leg to their goal.

"Just look on the bright side." Yoh said. "If we went up the other leg, it would probably be really cold."

"And how exactly is that supposed to comfort me?" Len asked scathingly.

Before Yoh could answer something caught his eye. In the distance there appeared to be a large building of some sort. Suprisingly enough, something actually lived in this barren land!

"Len look!" Yoh said pointing.

Len looked where Yoh was pointing and saw the same building.

"It looks like some kind of temple..." Len mused to himself.

"Who cares what it is?" Yoh said. "It'll make a great place to take a break from all this walking!"

And without a further word, Yoh was running to the temple. Len sighed and walked after him, retaining at least some of his dignity. However close the temple may have looked, it still took a good three hours to get there, leaving Len and Yoh completely exhausted. They nearly collapsed at the doors of the temple, which were enormous, but managed to stay up and lean against the door. Unfortunately, after much pushing it was soon apparent that the doors weren't going to open easily.

"Now what do we do?" Len said, sitting with his back to the door.

"Knock?" Yoh said, doing so.

"That is the most ridiculous idea I've ever heard!" Len shouted. "Like the doors are just going to magically open because you knock! I mean the very idea is ludi--"

The rest of his words were drowned out as the doors opened inward with a loud grinding sound of stone against stone. Len slapped himself on the forehead and, grumbling and complaining, followed Yoh inside.
125121212111122112121111211.title: Journey to the Temple of Fire

12512121211112211212111122.content:
"Look Len" Yoh tried explaning. "Trey already is a god, why fight it? Its not as if its bad here. Sure, we're on the sole of a foot large enough to us the solar system as a stepping stone, but it isn't too bad. I mean, how can you not think of him as god, since well... he is?"

Len was sick of this talk. All he wanted to do was to take Trey down.

"Fine Yoh, you stay here and worship Trey. I'm going to find a way to take his place." Len replied.

Yoh thought about it for a while. It did sound appealing. Not swapping Trey for Len, but it would be cool if instead of Trey as the god, Yoh could be.
12512121211112211212111122.title: Pondering

choices: Hours later, they still haven't got very far
Suddenly, the pair spot some strange glowing thing in the distance...
125121212111122112121111222.content:
Len and Yoh traveled on and on, not making as much progress as they would've hoped as they scaled the cosmic form of Trey. Len was determined to find a way to shrink Trey and enlarge himself beyond even this size, to take over the entire universe if he could. He wanted all to worship him in awe and fear. Yoh, meanwhile, just liked the idea of being big enough that no one could force him to do anything he didn't want to do, like train, or work, or run errands for Anna...wherever she was now.

After hours of trekking they decided to take a quick break. Len looked on at the seemingly endless expanse of flesh before him. Even if they managed to make it up the legs, through the bottom of Trey's shorts (shudder), across Trey's massive stomach, between his collosal pecs, and up towards the face, what would it accomplish? Trey would barely be able to see them, let alone talk to them. No, Len was hoping to find something on the way to the face that would allow him to take Trey's place as a god.

"This is taking forever!" Yoh said, shielding his eyes and looking on. "At this rate, we'll be dead before we get anywhere."

"Shut up! We just have to step up our game!" Len said. "Come on! We're going to run as fast as we can to get up there!"

Yoh groaned at the sudden manic energy Yoh seemed to possess and chased after him.
125121212111122112121111222.title: Traveling Across Trey

choices: They make it to... Trey's crotch!
They make it to... Trey's foot! They went backwards!
1251212121111221121211112221.content:
The trouble they found was Trey was just too large. His big toe's sole housed an entire continent, so ordinary people were... well too small to even contemplate. Entire cities were the size of microbes to him.

This was the flaw in any attempt to contact him. He was too big to do anything with.

But for the moment their task was getting to his face. Hopefully when they got there something would reveal itsself.


Suddenly, and shockingly enough, Yoh had a brainwave.
"Hey Len, what if we combine all of our power and use all of it to teleport us as far up as we can go?" Yoh asked.
"How would that help?" Len scorned. "We'd be drained of all energy!"
"Yeah, but think about it. If we walk, we're walking millions of miles. I mean look at it, we're not even past his ankle yet. But if we do this, at least we're a lot closer. Then we can rest a while and when we've built up enough energy we can do it again!"

Oddly enough, it did make some sense. Just walking it would take years even to reach Trey's knees.

So Len gave in and they prepared to teleport. How far would they get?
1251212121111221121211112221.title: New plan, walking sucks!

choices: They regain their energy and move on
12512121211112211212111122211.content:
So, having decided on a course of action, Len and Yoh combined all their furyoku together and released it all to teleport further along the body. Everything zipped by in a blur of color until they were in total darkness, where they stopped. Both boys were exhausted and panting. The air around them was thick and musky which didn't seem like a good sign to Len.

"So where are we now?" Yoh asked, trying to see something other then total darkness.

"I have no idea." Len said. "And, thanks to someone's brilliant plan, I don't have enough energy to make a light!"

Yoh didn't say anything. He was feeling around with his hands. He felt the ground and found it to be softer than other areas they had been. He then walked a few steps forward and felt what appeared to be a gigantic tree of some sort. He moved a few steps in the other direction and felt another tree.

"Hey Len! I think we're in a forest!" Yoh said.

"A forest? Are you insane? There are no for--"

Then he put two and two together. Traveling along a body, hot, musky air, "trees" surrounding them. Len shuddered in revoltion as he realized they were on Trey's gigantic crotch, surrounded by his pubic hair!

"AAAAAAAAHHHHHH!!!!" Len screamed, charging at Yoh. "THIS IS ALL YOUR FAULT!!!!!"

He tackled Yoh and started throttling him. "Now we're trapped here in this hell hole for who knows how long!!!"

Yoh couldn't say anything, but after a few minutes he managed to throw Len off. Both boys were too tired to do much else, except lay where they were. Soon, they both fell asleep.
12512121211112211212111122211.title: Len's Worst Nightmare

125121212111122112121111222112.content:
Len suddenly stalks away from Yoh. He's sick of everything, and ending up in the forest is just the absolute worst things that could happen to him.

Meanwhile Yoh is hearing a noise of someone walking through the jungle. Deciding not to go after Len, he heads towards the rustling.


Who does he stumble across.... Zeke!
125121212111122112121111222112.title: Someone Else

1251212121111221121211112221121.content:
Yoh was shocked to see his twin trapped in the same place as him. Zeke had a small light in front of him so he could see where he was going but was now watching Yoh with a smile.

"What are you doing here?" Yoh asked, hoping a fight wouldn't break out since his energy was at zero.

"The same thing as you I expect." he answered. "I'm just trying to make my way to the face. I was just stopping here because I heard you two shouting."

"We weren't fighting just...discussing." Yoh said, crossing his arms.

"Whatever you call it. Well, I thought you might've been a threat but now I see you're nothing to worry about, so I'll be going."

"Wait! How long did you say you were here?"

"About three minutes."

"And you started at the feet?"

"With everyone else."

"So you shouldn't have enough power to move on yet!"

Zeke laughed and said, "You mean you don't have enough power to move on yet. I have more furyoku than either you or Len. So, I'll be going then."

Yoh watched as he turned around and prepared to leave. This wasn't good. He didn't want Zeke to get to the face before he or Len! That would be bad. There had to be some way to keep him here until they could move on. But even if they managed that, he would still be able to move on after that. Who knew how far he could get before he ran out of furyoku? There seemed to be only way.

"Why don't you travel with us?" Yoh asked innocently.

"And why would I want to do that?" Zeke said, turning his head back to look at Yoh.

"Well, there's safety in numbers and if all of us work together, I'm sure we'll find...whatever it is we're looking for, faster!"

Zeke closed his eyes and seemed to be thinking about it. Finally he opened his eyes again and said
1251212121111221121211112221121.title: Yoh's Proposal

choices: Yoh and Len move on again...
12512121211112211212111122211211.content:
Zeke closed his eyes and seemed to be thinking about it. Finally he opened his eyes again and said...

"I don't think so. You see, I have a plan, and I'm going to get to the face and then steal his energy. I know exactly how to do it. And then I'm going to not only have my power, but all of his power too. And I will be unstoppable. You think you've seen huge? I'm going to be universal. I'm going to grow so big that the entire universe is a mere speck, and then I'm going to restart the universe, rewriting everything so that I am worshipped by everyone on every planet in every galaxy."

"How would you do that?" Yoh asked, horrified.

"Its really simple, all I have to do is grow large enough to fit the universe down... well, lets just say a long *long* dark tunnel, and trust me, I will enjoy the feeling."

With that chilling remark, Zeke vanished.

"What was that about?" Yoh asked Len, who was looking sick.

"Are you kidding me? If Zeke gets his way we're all going to get even closer to him than we are to Trey! We have to beat him there!" Len replied.
12512121211112211212111122211211.title: Zeke's Plan

choices: Len absorbs the souls and grows even bigger than Trey
Yoh absorbs the souls and grows even bigger than Trey
125121212111122112121111222112111.content:
Wanting to waste no more time, Len grabbed Yoh and said, "Let's go!

They both concentrated and hurled themselves the rest of the way to Trey's face. They landed, exhausted, on the forehead. In front of them was a huge blue crystal that seemed to be made of ice. Len, out of breath, looked around and said, "Good. We beat him here."

"You'd like to think that wouldn't you?" a voice said.

Both Yoh and Len looked and saw Zeke coming out from behind the crystal.

"I'm actually surprised you made it here so soon." Zeke said. "I was going to wait so you both could witness the beginning of the new universe."

Zeke put his hand on the crystal and closed his eyes. Nothing seemed to happen and Zeke's eyes opened again. He smiled and said, "This crystal is a manifestation of all the souls Trey has absorbed to gain this size. All I have to do is drain the crystal and its powers will be added to my own. Trey will shrink back down to normal size and you will all become less than bacteria on my body."

Zeke then turned his back on the two worn out shaman and closed his eyes. The crystal and his body began to glow brightly. Len and Yoh both started panicking. If they let Zeke continue the universe was done for! Thinking fast, they both pulled out their respective weapons and hurled them at the crystal. They both stuck in the crystal which suddenly pulsed, forcing Zeke backward. He looked shocked as the crystal began to crack apart. He frowned, knowing what was going on. Both their weapons had shattered the crystal, interrupting his ritual. Now the souls were going to break free and absorb into one of their bodies. The question was: whose?
125121212111122112121111222112111.title: Zeke's Plan: Foiled

1251212121111221121211112221121112.content:
The souls rushed out of the blue crystal, and swirled around the expansive landscape of Trey's forehead. They flew past Trey's eyes, and together they were dense enough for Trey to see a little more than a shadow.

The souls returned and converged around the group, settling into Yoh. As he stood there, the souls were absorbed by his body.

Len and Zeke watched on in horror, as the ground began to shake. This was shocking, as Trey was so large that he was usually still. Yoh was expanding quickly, and in a few seconds he was out of sight, so large that Zeke and Len were quickly pinned by his massive feet.

Trey felt something growing on his forehead, it was weird. Whatever was there was getting annoying. Thinking it was a bug, he pointed his finger to crush it.

Meanwhile, even though Yoh was massive, he still wasn't any match for Trey at the moment. The uninmaginably huge finger hovered above the sky, the single finger taking up the entire sky. But it was getting smaller.
1251212121111221121211112221121112.title: Yoh absorbs the souls and grows even bigger tha...

choices: Yoh decides to go through with Zeke's plan and starts growing faster
Yoh takes this opportunity to rest. Trey tries to figure out what happened
12512121211112211212111122211211121.content:
Suddenly, as his finger was poised to eradicate the bug on his forehead, Trey felt a strange swooping sensation in his stomach, like being in an elevator that suddenly started dropping. He could feel his immense, godly power, draining from him. In short, he was shrinking. As Yoh continued to grow, the power flowing through him in staggering amounts, Trey started shrinking to meet him. Within seconds, both processes started increasing, Yoh getting dramatically bigger, while Trey grew less and less. Minutes later Trey saw Yoh's tiny form suddenly balloon into his sight. Both Yoh and Trey gasped as their gazes landed on each other, seeing one another in full sight for the first time since yesterday. One minute, they were staring each other in the eyes, the next, Yoh was twice Trey's size. Trey gaped up at his friend as he increased more and more, his body taking up all his sight. Soon, Yoh's massive torso filled his sight completely. Trey looked left and right, up and down, but couldn't see past Yoh's huge belly. Suddenly Trey felt a powerful pull, dragging him closer to Yoh's huge body. Yoh had grown to the point that his body had developed a gravity field capable of pulling Trey's body onto his own. Within seconds Trey felt his bare feet touch on Yoh's massive belly. Smaller and smaller, bigger and bigger, both boys continued to change until Trey reached his normal size. He felt weak, indescribably weak. All the power he had commanded was now gone, seeking refuge within Yoh rather than him. Trey felt an emptiness within him. Looking around, he couldn't see anything except the landscape of flesh stretching in every direction. Sighing, Trey sat down and rested. He had no idea what just happened, but he was going to find out.

As Trey rested on Yoh's belly, far, far, down, on his feet, Len and Zeke were standing on Yoh's colossal toenail. It was like standing on glass, glass far stronger than any known substance in creation, but glass nonetheless. Zeke had a sour look on his face as he realized his lifelong ambition had been snatched away from him...again. Len was livid. He had been so close to realizing true power. In one fell swoop he would've humiliated Trey, stolen his power, been reborn a god, and stolen Zeke's plan from him! All the universe would've been his! Thinking of Zeke's plan, Len had a sudden, chilling thought. What if Yoh decided to do it? Would he? Len looked at Zeke and could tell he was thinking the same thing. Unfortunately, Yoh was many times larger than Trey had been and no doubt had the power to continue growing. Whereas he, Len, was still far from recovering his powers to traverse the body again. Zeke seemed to have used up a lot of his own power, since he wasn't immediately heading to the forehead to steal Yoh's power. Zeke saw him looking and said, "My powers are still strong."

Len flinched a little. That was awfully perceptive of him. Wishing to hide his mistake, Len said defiantly, "Then why haven't you gone to the forehead to steal Yoh's power from him?"

Zeke smiled in a sardonic, belittling way. "It's not going to be in the same place as before. Nor will it be a crystal. The only reason it was a crystal before, was because the boy was an Ice Shaman. Who knows what form it'll take for Yoh, or where it will placed?"

Len rolled his eyes and said, "Please, then how did you know Trey's would be on the forehead?"

Zeke replied, "Simple. I divined it using my own shaman powers. Unfortunately, it was a spell I am only able to use once every few decades. It could take years to search this entire body completely."

'And, if Yoh goes through with your plan, we'll have even less time!' Len thought to himself.

It all hinged on whether or not Yoh would decide to go through with the plan and send the universe down that long, dark tunnel.
12512121211112211212111122211211121.title: Yoh's Rebirth

125121212111122112121111222112111211.content:
Unfortunately for everyone else, Yoh's growth had a negative affect. Since Zeke and Len were also hit with the spirits, just not enough to do anything, they remained at their same size. But everyone else on Trey's body started to shrink along with Trey, remaining in proportion. And unfortunately for them, when Trey touched down on Yoh's stomach, his feet made contact, crushing those left on his soles. Many survived, but many more were obliterated. To them, Trey is just as big as he's ever been, and Yoh is just universal.

Yoh felt strange with his new power. But his size also added a sense of power, and that sense of power was increasing his ego. Perhaps Zeke had a point? Why shouldn't he rebuild the universe in his image? What's stopping him from becoming god?

The image of himself being worshipped by an entire universe was appealing, and this inflated his ego once more, which in turned continued his exponential growth. Yoh wouldn't have very long until he could carry out the plan.

Meanwhile, far down on the toe nail, Zeke and Len weren't getting along. Both of them felt robbed, being stuck as a far smaller creature on a behemoth.
125121212111122112121111222112111211.title: Yoh decides to go through with Zeke's plan ...

choices: Zeke and Len try to find the souls
Trey stumbles upon the souls, but doesn't know what they are...
1251212121111221121211112221121112111.content:
Yoh could feel the power welling up inside him, threatening to overcome him and explode his size outward and upward, past the farthest reaches of the universe until all that was left was a speck. A speck that would be forced down Yoh's cock to be reborn in his image, with an entire universe of worshipers. To achieve that goal, all he had to to was wait a little while longer, to let his power expound itself over and over.

Len and Zeke were both determined that this would not come to pass. They both knew they had to do something or else Yoh would go along with the plan and they would trapped as bugs in a universe that was dedicated to worshiping Yoh! Len turned to Zeke and said, "You may not be able to use furyoku to sense the souls, but if we combine our power we should be able to at least look for it."

Zeke frowned and said, "I suppose I have no choice." He smiled then and said, "I guess I don't mind using another pawn."

Len ground his teeth as he heard those words, but didn't say anything. He need this jerks help after all. So they joined hands and concentrated on a specific part of Yoh's body. They only had enough power for three jumps...they had to make them count!

As Len and Zeke planned their Yoh tour, he was still confused by what had happened. One second, he was a gigantic god with an entire planet at his mercy, trapped on his feet. Then, suddenly, Yoh was outgrowing him, and he felt weaker than ever! It didn't make sense! What exactly was going on? With no way of answering these questions, Trey just wandered aimlessly, crossing mile after mile of endless skin.
1251212121111221121211112221121112111.title: Yoh Prepares

13.content:
Len was in his training room. Working the weights in order to get stronger to defeat his rival Yoh Asakura. His rival was planning on coming over today so that the two of them could train.

"180, 181, 182." Finally Len finished as he put the weights down. Grabbing a towel, he wrapped it around his legs. Bason had appeared next to him as he finished his workout. He didn't like to be disturbed as he worked. Not even Bason was allowed around him when he worked out.

"How was your workout sir?" Bason asked his master.

"As good as always. I have no doubt I will beat him today in this training session." Len said as he grabbed a bottle of milk. Opening it, he drank it all till nothing was left.

Throwing it into the trash, Len went downstairs. He was ready to fight Yoh. But knowing him he'd be an hour late
13.title: Len's training session

choices: The strange energy begins to affect him as Yoh takes his time(slow growth)
Yoh arrives and the two fight. Not noticing Len's small growth spurt(two inches)
Len proceeds to leave out of boredom. Allowing Yoh to arrive and wait for Len.
131.content:
It took no time for Len to arrive at their training session. Len noticed that as usual, Yoh was nowhere to be found. "Of course that idiot wouldn't be here on time." Len growled in annoyance. He arrived at the center of their training spot. Which was on a hill deep in the mountains. It was place where him and Yoh would train regularly. It had four tall pillars in each direction and was covered in a thick, heavy fog which only allowed the hill, pillars, and tallest trees to be seen. The hill itself was at the center. Len noticed the first time they found this place that the center looked like a beacon. The center of the stone made of stone and strange markings. Plus there was a unearthly peace about this place.

Which could almost make Len calm. Almost. "Dammit! That bastard is making me wait on purpose!" Len spat angrily. Bason trying desperately to appease his master by saying that someone was making Yoh late. Or that he could be under attack at the moment. But those didn't stop him from being angry.

Walking towards the center. Len sat down in the center of the hill. Upon the very center of the ancient stone ground with the mysterious carvings. He closed his eyes and started to place himself in a meditative state. "Baston. I am going to meditate and hope that silences my rage. So. Do. Not. Disturb. Me!" Len spat angrily.

"Understood Master Len." Bason said as he silenced himself alongside his master.

Len began to meditate in pure silence as his servant went quiet. Drawing the spirits around him to him. The ground began to glow with each spirit, putting Len deeper into his trance as more spirits began to appear until the center stone symbols were glowing.

Unbeknownst to him, the four pillars in each direction began to glow as well. The Southern Pillar glowed red, a fire symbol surrounding a Pheonix appearing above it as strange fire energy began to travel from the pillar's glowing symbol to the Hill. Then the East began to glow green. The power of wind flowing around the Blue Dragon and to the hill. The North PIllar glowing blue as the Black Turtle appeared, sending the element of water to the Hill. Finally the Western pillar glowed brown, the White Tiger appearing as the earth energy traveled to the hill as hill.

Each pillar's elemental energy gathered above Len. Fusing into a single glorious golden ball of light. Len, too deep in meditation and put into a trance by the spirits in order for the transformation to continue, was engulfed by the golden light for 9 minutes until it finally disappeared. The pillars glowing symbols faded and the spirits around Len drifted away. Releasing Len from his trance.

Stretching his arms as he began to awaken from it. Len smiled a arrogant smirk "That was a great nap!"
131.title: Power of the 5th Element

135.content:
Len gathered his gear he needed to battle Yoh. Slinging it on his back, he then headed to the agreed battle location, the forest above the village. He knew Yoh would be late, so this would give him a chance to check out the location for any obstacals.

Basson would remain at home, as would Amidamaru, as Yoh and Len had decided it would be a Shaman against Shaman fight, no guardian ghosts. This made Len confident, as he knew physically he was stronger than Yoh. He would dominate and humiliate the cocky shaman, until Yoh crawled to him begging for mercy. Yoh would grovel at his feet.

Reaching the battle location, Len dropped his gear and scouted for the best starting position.

At that moment he felt a pang in his stomach. Something was wrong.
135.title: Len alone

choices: The pain returns and Len faints and grows
Yoh arrives and the fight begins
1352.content:
Len stopped and held his stomach, grimacing in pain. He began to wonder if that milk he'd drank had been spoiled. Whatever it was, it soon passed. Shaking it off, Len made a circuit around the area where he and Yoh would be fighting. He marked areas that Yoh could hide behind, soft spots on the ground, places to ambush if need be, and all a manner of things like that. When he had the battlefield completely memorized, he sat down and waited for Yoh to arrive. He checked his watch and sighed in frustration. Yoh was getting to be later than usual. It frustrated Len to no end that somehow who was so lazy had so much talent. But today it didn't matter how good Yoh was at channeling and controling ghosts because they weren't allowed in the fight. Len's constant training had honed his body into a fighting machine. He had greater stamina as well. Oh, how Len relished the idea of Yoh laying before him, completely defeated and at his mercy.

Today would be his day!
1352.title: Still Waiting

13521.content:
Len doubles over in pain. Kneeling in the forest he closes his eyes in a grimace. Opening them he noticed the ground looked different. Standing up he suddenly realised what was wrong.

He had grown. And not by a few inches, but more about a few feet. Len was now around 101 feet tall. He could squash Yoh with a single foot-step.

Looking at himself he was stunned.

"Yoh has no chance against me now!" he thought to himself. "I can flatten him in a single step

Len stood in the forest so Yoh wouldn't see him before it was too late.

Little did Len know, that wasn't the first growth-spurt he would have.
13521.title: Growth

choices: Before Len can make a move, he starts to grow again
135211.content:
Len crouched slightly so he wouldn't stick out too much. He was now eagerly anticipating Yoh. It didn't matter what the obstacles might be or how the terrain was set up. As soon as the fight began, all Len would have to do is step on Yoh and it would be over. Without his spirit ally it would be over in seconds. He held perfectly still as he heard his tiny rival approaching.

"Hey Len sorry I'm late." Yoh said, scratching the back of his head. "I guess the time just escaped me."

Yoh looked around and stopped dead in his tracks as his eyes fell on the giant Len.

"Whoah! What happened to you Len?" Yoh said in awe.

Len merely smiled and said, "It doesn't matter does it? Shall we start the fight?"

"Are you serious?!?" Yoh yelled. "I can't fight you!"

Len's smile widened. "So sorry but I'm afraid you don't have a choice in the matter."

And with that Len stood up to his full height and advanced on Yoh.
135211.title: Unfair Fight

1352112.content:
As Len stepped towards Yoh to subdue him, he felt the cramp in his stomach again, and knelt down in pain.

Yoh watched in awe and terror as Len expanded. Yoh watched as the massive feet, once over twice his size suddenly expanded. He had to run back as the feet grew to over 8 times his size, making them around 50 feet long. The tiny shaman looked up as Len had expanded to over 330 feet tall. Compared to him, Yoh was around an inch tall.

Len opened his eyes and stood up again. He was pleased with his expansion. Now Yoh had no chance against him.

"Ready to rumble Yoh?" He asked mockingly.
"Hey Len, how about we talk about this..." Yoh mumbled.
"Hmmm... Nope! I'm ready to fight. Or are you too chicken to fight me just because I'm a little tall?"
"I'm not chicken... hell Len, you're a giant. You can flatten me with your big toe. It is slightly bigger than me!" Yoh said.

Len just smiled, and pinned Yoh down under his foot.
1352112.title: Another growth

choices: As soon as Len's back is turned, Yoh makes a break for it
13521122.content:
Len laughed at how easy it had been to trap his rival so completely. He barely had to exert any force and Yoh was wriggling under his toes. And did he ever wriggle! He may be laid back, but when he wanted to move he could really move! Of course it was all for naught as Len knew he couldn't do any real damage without Amidamaru helping him. He was in for a nasty surprise, however, as Yoh did the only thing he could think of doing. He opened his mouth as wide as he could and bit Len hard on the toe. The skin between his toes being extra sensitive, Len jumped back in pain, grabbing his foot and examining it for damage.

Using this oppurtunity, Yoh ran as fast he could, looking for a place to hide. He dove into a nearby ditch and rolled a rock over it to hide himself. He watched as Len looked angrily around. He knew Len might do something drastic after what Yoh had done, but it had been the only thing he could think of doing. Yoh began to wonder how Len got so freaking big in the first place. It couldn't be anything to do with shaman powers as they had both agreed not to use them. Unless Len had lied and was using Basong to help him! How unfair! But wait, that wasn't like Len. He may be arrogant but he was also fair.

As Yoh puzzled this out, Len was pushing aside trees and kicking up earth with his feet, looking for Yoh wherever he may be.
13521122.title: Run and Hide

135211221.content:
Len stompped around trying to find the tiny Yoh. He was annoyed now, and he wanted to get his feelings out there.

Suddenly he groaned, and then doubled in size. He was now over 800 feet tall. Yoh would be less than 1/2 inch to him.

He opened his eyes and looked as the ground was much further away. Seeing some rocks shift in a ditch, he grined.

Slamming his gigantic foot down next to the ditch, the rocks and the tiny Yoh were flung out of the ditch, and landing on the giant's foot.

"WHAT DO WE HAVE HERE?" He asked the bug.
135211221.title: Found

choices: "I want you to clean my feet!"
1352112212.content:
Finally Len had Yoh right where he wanted him. All it would take was one stomp and Yoh would be gone forever. His rivalry would finally be over and he would be proved superior!

But that would be far too easy on Yoh. Len knelt and stared at the boy on his foot. He smiled at him and said, "I'm giving you a choice since I'm feeling generous."

Yoh's heart was pounding. He didn't want to die so he listened closely.

"I can either crush you right now...or you could become my slave. Which is it?"

Yoh didn't like the sound of this. Being Len's slave would be hard, especially with a master so large. But really, what choice did he have?

"I-I'll be your slave." Yoh stuttered.

Len laughed and said, "Excellent! Now you're going to prove your loyalty right now. If you perform this next task well enough, things might get easier."

Len said this with a cocky grin that clearly said none of this was going to be easy.

"What do I have to do?" Yoh asked.
1352112212.title: Enslaved

choices: Yoh sticks out his tounge for Len
13521122122.content:
Len grinned as he plucked Yoh off his foot and sat down stretching his legs out so his feet were in Yoh's face. "I want you to clean my feet!" Len said snottily. Yoh's jaw dropped, "WHAT!?" Yoh said shocked. "You heard me! Besides I think you owe me something after biting my foot AND causing me to get them all dirty looking for you!" he said pointing to his soles which were covered in dirt. "Just look at all that dirt on my soles!" he said, then he spread his big toe apart with his fingers, "And theres even more dirt BETWEEN my toes! It's disgusting! And this is a perfect way for you to prove your loyalty!" he said wiggling his massive toes.

"P-Please Len, can't I do something else!?" Yoh pleaded. Len then stomped his foot down beside Yoh, "Aww....whats wrong Yoh? Are you afraid? You're lucky my feet don't smell, or else this would be alot harder for you!" he said laughing and flexing his toes. "O-Okay I-I'll do it. But I don't have a wash cloth!" he said. Len laughed hysterically, "Oh please Yoh do you really think I'd have you clean my feet with ANYTHING......but your tounge!?" he said which caused Yoh's eyes to bug out.
13521122122.title: Len's new foot cleaner

choices: Hours later, Yoh finally finishes cleaning Len's feet
135211221221.content:
Yoh was no fool. He knew if he didn't do this now, Len would make things even more difficult for him. Or he might even crush him for disobedience! No, the best thing to do right now was what he wanted until he could figure out just what was going on. So he approached the massive left foot and Len lowered it so it was flat on the ground. Yoh decided to start with the big toe and work his way down. Closing his eyes, he stuck out his tongue and touched it to Len's toe and started licking. It wasn't as bad as he thought it would be. Len obviously showered regularly and the feet tasted more like soap than anything, though there was the taste of sweat and dirt to contend with, not to mention Len's natural scent. The toe was kind of rough and his tongue was so small, Yoh knew he would be at this for a long time.

Len grinned as he watched Yoh clean his feet. The power he felt over him was simply amazing. He watched as Yoh disappeared entirely just from moving in between his toes. Yoh was too small for Len to properly feel his tongue, but he knew Yoh wouldn't dare disobey him by using his hands to try and clean off his foot.

Things were looking good for Len.
135211221221.title: Clean It...Or Else!

choices: A few hours later when Yoh wakes up...
Len decides to have some more fun with his size
1352112212211.content:
About 2 hours later Yoh finally finished cleaning BOTH of Len's feet. Even though it took awhile, Len enjoyed every minute of it even though he couldn't feel it. Yoh's tounge was numb and red from so many hours of licking Len's rough soles. Len lifts his foot off of Yoh and brings it to his face to see how he did, he seemed to be looking for even the tiniest speck of dirt so he would have a reason to beat on Yoh. However Yoh actually licked his feet squeaky clean! And after inspecting the other one Len looked at him, "Good job Yoh! You should consider making a career out of this!" Len mocked him.

Yoh didn't care what Len said, as long as he got to rest. "I suppose it's only fair that I give you a reward Yoh, I mean you did exactly what I told you. And you didn't miss a spot on my feet! In fact......I'm proud of you Yoh!" Len said smiling. Yoh wasn't too tired to feel shock from hearing Len being so nice to him though! His eyes widened in shock but he decided he'd best keep his mouth shut.

"Okay I guess you can take a rest. I guess you do deserve it." Len said grudgingly. Within seconds Yoh was asleep, "Yeah thats right Yoh, you'd better rest up because things are going to get alot harder from now on. Believe me!" Len thought evilly.
1352112212211.title: Len's Inspection

choices: Len returns with another task for Yoh
Len's back and has grown even bigger
13521122122111.content:
Yoh slept on, relieved that he was able to take a break. It had been hell, licking and licking with nothing to see but Len's toes and nothing to smell but Len's foot stink, sweaty from training and chasing after Yoh. And the taste! The taste of dirt all over! He'd never be able to wash that taste away! His poor tongue felt like it was permenantely scraped red and the rest of his body was sore from running, getting thrown around, and giving a forced lick to Len's feet. But now he was released. Blessed sleep washed over him and for now, the horrors of the day were stripped away. Of course, he didn't know what new horrors awaited him once he awoke.

Finally, after several hours, Yoh slowly woke up, confused at first as to why he was in a clearing in the woods. Then the memories came rushing back, the licking, the mocking, the dirt. He looked around trying to see where Len was. It shouldn't exactly be hard to find him, he was hard to miss. But he seemed to have left for the time being which filled Yoh with hope.

Unfortunately, before he'd even thought of a place to run to, the ground started to vibrate under his feet. Len was obviously coming back from whatever he had been doing. Yoh collapsed to his butt, the hope that had ballooned inside, effectively punctured.
13521122122111.title: Resting for Now

choices: Slow Big - Grows large very slowly
Fast Big - Grows large almost instantly
Slow Titanic - Grows very large very slowly
Fast Titanic - Grows very large almost instantly
14.content:
Zeke was excited. This was the tournament. He could feel it.

For the last 1000 years he had been reviving himself for each Shaman King tournament, And when he became Shaman King, he would essentially rule the world.

Zeke didn't know how it would happen, but he knew that it would happen this time. Yoh would be involved, and Zeke would rule all.

He lay back and fell into a dream. In his dream Zeke had reached the village where the fights are taking place. Then he was attacked by the shaman scum, but they were stopped when Zeke expanded, growing to massive heights. He managed to crush the entire village with a single foot step. The sights of the gigantic shaman's foot hovering against the tiny shaman was empowering.

After he had ground the village into dust, Zeke strode to the spirit sanctuary where the King of Spirits resided. In front of him was the tiny Yoh, fire in his eyes, ready to fight.
In a single step Zeke hovered his foot over his twin.
As he stepped forward, crushing Yoh under his foot, he reached and took the King of Spirits in his hads. Holding the all powerful spirit king in his massive hand, Zeke swalloed him whole, absorbing his power.

With that, Zeke swelled and expanded. He was more than the Shaman King. He was a god. He could crush cities under a single foot. He ruled the world. Nobody could stop him.

With that final thought, Zeke awoke from his dream. He was slightly disorientated, as he found he wasn't the gigantic all powerful ruler of the world.

Not yet anyway.
14.title: Zeke

choices: Zeke grows a bit more before finding an oracle bell
145.content:
The Shaman King tournament had officially begun. The shaman council had decided to ignore Zeke, so he couldn't get an oracle bell or enter the tournament.


"I must get an oracle bell, I must enter this tournament." Zeke thought to himself. "I've waited 1000 years for this, and I am not going to lose again. I will become Shaman King, I will wipe the world of humanity, and I will become a god!"

Zeke sighed and sat down. Being the villain wasn't as easy as the hero's thought.

Quietly he sat there, meditating. Concentrating his power. But he didn't notice that while meditating, he was going under a physical change.

Opening his eyes, Zeke realized he had grown slightly. With the few seconds of meditation, Zeke had already grown to 20 feet.

Zeke grinned, as he now knew how to get his oracle bell.
145.title: Zeke

15.content:
What other characters?
Pick a path. Name the character in the title of the first chapter.
I'll edit this post.

Right now this is just reserved, as I have no idea what other guys people would want to write about.
15.title: Other

info.brief_description: A story where the guys of Shaman King grow to titanic heights.
info.description:
Shaman King Giants
They guys of Shaman King grow to titanic heights.

Sadly, there are a few rules.
1. This is a guys story. Giant Guys. No girls sorry.
2. No getting fat. This isn't that kind of story.
3. No toilet stuff. It isn't wanted.
4. No crossovers. Reasoning: They create confusion, specially when names are misspelled and such. This story is about Shaman King, so keep it there.

Character Names: The characters are all from the English anime, so please keep those names.
eg: Tao Ren is known as Len or Lenny in English.
Please keep it that way.

All characters are out of character! There is no way Yoh really would rampage ect.

Posts: Please keep posts to do with the story. I don't want any chapters added complaining about things. I'll just delete them. Chapters are for stories, not rants. (I've seen good stories ruined by loser's ranting).
